duck: Detection limit - In analytical chemistry, the detection limit, lower limit of detection, or LOD (limit of detection), is the lowest quantity of a substance that can be distinguished from the absence ...
Airy points - Airy Points are used for precision measurement to support a length standard in such a way as to minimise bending or droop.
Differential linearity - In measurement systems differential linearity refers to a constant relation between the change in the output and input.
Dimensionless number - In dimensional analysis, a dimensionless quantity or quantity of dimension one is a quantity without an associated physical dimension.
measurement definition: the act or process of measuring.
Conversion of units - Conversion of units is the conversion between different units of measurement for the same quantity, typically through multiplicative conversion factors.
Measurement (from Old French, mesurement) is the assignment of numbers to objects or events.
Dimensional analysis - In physics and all science, dimensional analysis is the practice of checking relations among physical quantities by identifying their dimensions.
